TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RefreshInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines the information for the refresh of a registration entry by a peer resolver service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a peer resolver service refreshes an entry, it sets a new expiry on that entry. An instance of this object must be supplied to the peer resolver service for each peer node that should have its expiration refreshed; otherwise, the entry is marked as stale and will be deleted after a specific interval for cleanup has passed.
Instances of this class are primarily used to pass information to the resolver service from a network client of that service.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new default instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string meshId, valuetype System.Guid regId) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.String> that identifies the mesh in which the peer node participates.
A <xref:System.Guid> that uniquely identifies the registration entry for the peer node.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the provided mesh ID and unique registration ID.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool HasBody() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the body of the message containing a serialized instance of this type is correctly formed.
Docs.returns: True if the refresh information message body is correctly formed by the sender (the service client); false if it is not.

Docs.summary: Gets the mesh ID of the registration entry to refresh.
Docs.value: <xref:System.String> that contains the mesh ID of the registration entry that will be refreshed in the peer resolver registration lookup table.

Docs.summary: Gets the unique registration ID of the registration entry to refresh.
Docs.value: <xref:System.Guid> that contains the registration ID of the peer node whose entry will be refreshed in the peer resolver registration lookup table.
